document.docAuthor: Pereira-Colavite, Alessandre & De, Claudio J. B.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of Neomuscina Townsend (Diptera, Muscidae) from Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of Neomuscina Townsend (Diptera, Muscidae) from Brazil

bibRefCitation.author: Snyder
bibRefCitation.refString: Snyder, F. M. (1949) Revision of Neomuscina Townsend. American Museum Novitates, 1404, 1 - 39.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis : acrostichal 0: 1 ; dorsocentral 2 : 4 ; male: intra-alar 1 ; mid femur with three preapical setae; wing hyaline with dark cloud running from R 1 joining with a cloud on r-m; R 2 + 3 with dark cloud at apex; dm-cu with a dark cloud; female: sternite VIII with strong spike-like setae.

Color : general body coloration brownish yellow; frons yellow, apex darkened; facialia and parafacialia white; frontalia and parafrontalia with dark apex and yellow base; antenna and palpus yellow; scutum with four dark stripes of grey pruinosity; fore femur with basal third dark brown; median and hind femora with basal two thirds dark brown; calypters and halter white; wing hyaline, with dark cloud running from R 1 joining a cloud on r-m; R 2 + 3 with dark cloud on apex; dm-cu with a dark cloud.
Male . Length. Body: 6.0– 6.2 mm ; wing: 6.5–6.7 mm .

Head : eyes separated from each other by 0.09–0.12 mm , at level of ocellar tubercle; 11 pairs of frontal setae; ocellar seta large and parallel; postocellar seta large and divergent; inner vertical and outer vertical setae small and divergent.

Thorax : acrostichal 0: 1 ; dorsocentral 2 : 4 ; intra-alar 1 ; fore tibia with a distinct median anterodorsal seta; apex of fore tibia with setae on anterodorsal, dorsal, posterodorsal, posteroventral surfaces; mid femur with a row of setae on posteroventral surface from base to middle; mid femur with three preapical setae, on dorsal, posterodorsal and posterior surfaces; apex of mid tibia with setae on anterior, posterodorsal, posteroventral, ventral and anteroventral surfaces; hind femur with a complete row of dorsal and anteroventral setae, and a row of posteroventral setae from base to middle; hind tibia with one median anterodorsal setaand three median anteroventral setae; hind tibia with anterior, anterodorsal, dorsal and ventral setae at apex; wing with one or two dorsal and one ventral setae at apex of stem vein.
Abdomen : fifth sternite slightly projected at base; epandrium slightly projected; cercus slightly blunt apically.

Female (differing as follows): Length. Body: 6.2–6.3 mm ; wing: 6.6–6.8 mm ; eyes separated from each other by 0.3–0.31 mm , at level of ocellar tubercle; 10–11 pairs of frontal convergent setae, except for upper two pairs, divergent; ocellar and postocellar setae large and divergent; inner vertical seta large and convergent, and outer vertical seta large and divergent; intra-alars 2 ; sternites VI and VII strongly sclerotized; sternite VIII with strong spike-like setae; epiproct with four setae, setae in a square-shaped arrangement ( 2 : 2 ).

Comments : Males of
N. neosimilis
have a slightly narrowed fifth sternite and cerci, in posterior view. Females are characterized by a long and prominent seta on the ovipositor.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 65–70.
Neomuscina neosimilis
. Male terminalia: 65. Fifth sternite, dorsal view; 66. Epandrium, surstylus and cercal plate, lateral view; 67. Epandrium, surstylus and cercal plate, posterior view; 68. Aedeagus, lateral view. Female terminalia: 69. Dorsal view; 70. Ventral view. (Scale 0.5 mm)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype
(not examined): AMNH . Type-locality: Nova Teutônia, Santa Catarina.
